title: (Week 35 - 37) Group B Streptococcus Screening
body: Approximately 10 to 30 percent of pregnant women carry GBS in the vagina or rectum or surrounding area. While GBS is generally harmless in healthy adults, it may cause stillbirth and serious infections in babies.

title: (Week 24 - 28) Glucose Screening
body: Gestational diabetes is a high blood sugar condition that some women get during pregnancy. Between 2 and 5 percent of expectant mothers develop this condition, making it one of the most common health problems during pregnancy. And because the condition rarely causes any symptoms, testing is the only way to find out whether you have it.

title: (Week 24) Abortion
body: Most states prohibit abortions after 24 weeks although there are exceptions.

title: (Week 18-20) Dating ultrasound
body:
A detailed ultrasound where each part of the body is examined.

RESULTS: Immediate.

title: (Week 15-22) Amniocentesis
body:
A small amount of amniotic fluid that surrounds the fetus is testing for chromosome and genetic tests. Diagnostic test, but comes with a small chance of miscarriage.

TURNAROUND: Rapid results within 48 hours but confirmatory tests take 7 – 14 days.

title: (Week 15-22) Second trimester blood test, known as triple or quad test
body:
Tests for Down and Edwards syndrome and neural tube defects such as spina bifida. Results are not diagnostic and many false positives can occur.

TURNAROUND: Usually 7-10 days.

title: (Week 10.5-14) Nuchal fold scan and first trimester blood test
body:
Uses ultrasound to measures the clear space in the tissue at the back of fetus’s neck. Babies with chromosomal disorders, such as Down syndrome, tend to accumulate this fluid during the first trimester. Can be combined with blood tests for more definitive results. Results are not diagnostic and must be confirmed.

TURNAROUND: Usually within a week.

title: (Week 10 - 13) CVS - Chorionic Villus Sampling
body:
Doctors use a need to remove a small amount of tissue called the chorionic villi to test for genetic or chromosomal disorders. Diagnostic, but it comes with a small risk of miscarriage.

TURNAROUND: Initial results can occur within 48 hours although confirmatory results usually take 7-14 days.

title: (Week 10-14) First trimester ultrasound
body:
Confirmation the fetus is growing and developing normally. Often a parent’s first look at a baby.

RESULTS: Immediate.

title: Non-invasive prenatal screening
body:
New tests that detect placental DNA in a mother’s blood for genetic disorders such as Down syndrome. While detection rates are better than previous screenings, the tests do have significant percentages of false positives and should not be considered diagnostic.

TURNAROUND: About 7-10 days.

title: (Week 2-3) Home Pregnancy Test
body:
Home pregnancy tests can be bought at virtually any drug store and detects a pregnancy hormone. If they are used too early, you may not get a reliable result.

TURNAROUND: Within minutes.
